department: Department of Public Works and Government Services
description: The contract will provide grease interceptor maintenance services to 5 CDSB Gagetown, Oromocto, NB. This includes cleaning and disposing of waste residue.
full_summary:
# Invitation to Bid
**ITT: Grease Interceptor Maintenance Service Contract - CFB Gagetown**
=====================================

**Reference Number:** WS4555987761-Doc4566205311
**Amendment Number:** 0
**Publication Date:** May 2, 2024

**Invitation Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
**Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites qualified Contractors to submit a bid for a one-year Service Contract with two optional one-year periods for Maintaining Grease Interceptors at the Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Gagetown, Oromocto, New Brunswick.

## Description of Work
The Contractor must provide all necessary labour, materials, tools, and equipment to:

- Pump out grease interceptors
- Remove waste residue from interceptors
- Transport and dispose of waste residue off Base to an approved location
- Report any damage or potential problems with the interceptors to the Engineer

## Contract Details
- Contract duration: One year from date of issuance
- Optional renewal: Two additional one-year periods

## Evaluation Criteria
The lowest price will be used as the evaluation criteria.

## Trade Agreements
This opportunity is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

## Delivery Location
The work will be performed at the CFB Gagetown, Oromocto, New Brunswick.

## Contact Information
For more information, please contact Gary Bryant, at:

* Email: [gary.bryant@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:gary.bryant@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* Phone: Not available
* Fax: Not available

**Notice URL:** [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19576629?extsite=MTk1NzY2MjlfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19576629?extsite=MTk1NzY2MjlfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==)

**Closing Date:** May 28, 2024, at 14:00:00. This opportunity has expired.  “
